thread.title: Back home, Blue Jays break out to beat Royals 11-8 in Game 3
thread.title_full: Back home, Blue Jays break out to beat Royals 11-8 in Game 3

title: Back home, Blue Jays break out to beat Royals 11-8 in Game 3
text:
Back home, Blue Jays break out to beat Royals 11-8 in Game 3 - WTOC-TV: Savannah, Beaufort, SC, News, Weather & Sports Member Center: Back home, Blue Jays break out to beat Royals 11-8 in Game 3 Posted: Updated: (Chris Young/The Canadian Press via AP). Toronto Blue Jays' Ryan Goins hits a home run off Kansas City Royals' pitcher Kris Medlen as catcher Salvador Perez looks on during the fifth inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series on... (AP Photo/Matt Slocum). Toronto Blue Jays' Ryan Goins rounds the bases after hitting a solo home run against the Kansas City Royals during the fifth inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Toronto. (AP Photo/Paul Sancya). Kansas City Royals starting pitcher Johnny Cueto leaves the game against the Toronto Blue Jays during the third inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Toronto. (AP Photo/Paul Sancya). Toronto Blue Jays' Troy Tulowitzki, left, has words with umpire Jeff Nelson, right, during the eight inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series against the Kansas City Royals on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in ... (Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press via AP). Toronto Blue Jays starting pitcher Marcus Stroman reacts after a pitch against the Kansas City Royals during the sixth inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, ... Updated: Monday, October 19 2015 11:30 PM EDT 2015-10-20 03:30:41 GMT The Royals jumped out to a 1-0 lead in the first inning of Game 3 of the ALCS, but the Blue Jays have come storming back. Toronto beat Kansas City 11-8. More >> The Royals jumped out to a 1-0 lead in the first inning of Game 3 of the ALCS, but the Blue Jays have come storming back. Toronto beat Kansas City 11-8. More >> By HOWIE RUMBERGAP Baseball Writer 
TORONTO (AP) - Troy Tulowitzki and Josh Donaldson each homered in a six-run third inning, and Toronto's bats broke out at home for an 11-8 victory over the Kansas City Royals on Monday night that trimmed the Blue Jays' deficit to 2-1 in the AL Championship Series. 
Ryan Goins also connected and had a two-run single, one game after his misplayed pop fly set off Kansas City's winning rally Sunday. 
Veteran knuckleballer R.A. Dickey will try to get the Blue Jays even in the best-of-seven series Tuesday afternoon. He faces Kansas City's 6-foot-10 right-hander Chris Young in Game 4. 
After the resilient Royals rallied for four runs in the ninth, Roberto Osuna closed it out. 
In the first ALCS game in Toronto since 1993, Tulowitzki connected for a three-run shot off Johnny Cueto, and Donaldson hit a two-run drive off Kris Medlen as the Blue Jays hit their first home runs of the series. 
Cueto failed to retire a batter in the third inning, allowing eight runs and six hits in the worst postseason start of his career. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. All rights reserved.
